hanzi-su-wiki:
嘉

Значения

Радостный, прекрасный

Мнемоника

Барабан 豆, литавры 士 и прибавлять 加. Воодушевлять солдат барабанным боем.
purpleculture_pinyin:
jiā
excellent; auspicious; to praise; to commend; excellent; auspicious; to praise; to commend
отлично; благоприятный; хвалить; похвалить; отлично; благоприятный; хвалить; похвалить
rtega_mnemonic:
嘉嘉RSexcellent, joyful; auspicious, praise
  • drum 壴 used to increase 加 the joy or praise
purpleculture_info: Pictophonetic: 加 indicates the sound; 壴 (drum) conveys the meaning.
purpleculture_examples:
嘉宾 [ jiā bīn ]: esteemed guest; honored guest; guest (on a show)
嘉奖 [ jiā jiǎng ]: to award; commendation; citation
可嘉 [ kě jiā ]: laudable
嘉许 [ jiā xǔ ]: favorable; praise
嘉年华会 [ jiā nián huá huì ]: carnival
purpleculture_tree:
• ⿱ Above to below
    • 壴 [ zhù ] drum
    • 加 [ jiā ] to add to, to increase, to augment
heisig_chinese_memo: Add a drum when you really want to commend someone's efforts and applaud.
WaniKani_Meaning_Mnemonic: If when you speak it sounds like the power of a drum is coming out of your mouth, then people will hold you in high esteem. Anyone who has a loud, booming, powerful voice will be held in high esteem in this day and age. Look at all those awesome musicians who have booming voices!
WaniKani_Meaning_Info: Imagine hearing someone speak and it's so powerful and loud that it sounds like they have a drum booming out of their mouth. You'll love them! You'll hold them in the highest esteem!
WaniKani_Reading_Mnemonic: You hold them in such high esteem that you give them your car (か). I ... I said you give them your car! Give them your car. Hey, hey!
WaniKani_Reading_Info: If you hold someone in high esteem you give me your- give them your car. Gimme!
Ru_Words:
嘉するよみする
  • одобрять, ценить
    • 嘉瑞かずい
  • добрая примета
    • 嘉納かのう
  • одобрение
    • 嘉賞かしょう
  • похвала
Ru_trainchinese: jiā: (прил/глаг) отличный, хороший, прекрасный; хвалить, превозносить
Kanshudo_mnemonic: the ten beans (壴) add (加) their praise
chinese_mnemonics_deck__story: Add a drum when you really want to commend someone's efforts and applaud.
humanum_full_description_en:
Oracle from " force " from " bean " from " come ", inscription from " claw " from " mouth ", and " plus " as the sound symbol. Chen Hanping thought that the word " lai " (麦子) is in " bean " In, it means that the food container contains food such as wheat and grass. The original meaning is the delicious food. Jia Jin inscription " come " or " wood ". The structure of Houma League books is varied, either the " claw " shape or the " bean " shape is omitted. The Warring States characters " Jia " or " Bean " in the province, refer to "Tsinghua Jane 1." "The Royal Gate" Jane 2. "Said Wen": "Ka, Mei Ye. Cong Wei, add sound."

The Oracle " Jia " is used as the place name, "Collection" 36838: "Cai (in) Jia." "Heji" 37434: "Today I walk in Jia, die (no) disaster."

In addition, the oracle bone inscriptions have the word " female " and " force ", which is the initial text of "妿". The first part of the oracle "妿" is often read as " jia ", or used in conjunction with " delivery " to inquire whether the childbirth is going well. "Collection" 6948: "Wu Hao delivery [女力] (Jia)." Fu Hao is the wife of Shang Wang Wu Ding. "Wu Hao Jia" means a smooth delivery. Say " Ka " means a boy, "No Ka 'That a girl. "Collection" 14002 is: "The broom (women) is good for childbirth, but it is not [women] (jia)."

The inscription " Jia " means good, Huanzi Meng Jianghu: "Qihou pays respects", "Jia" means beautiful life. Yang Shuda: "Qi Hou has invited him and the emperor has given him permission, and he has given him something, so it is called a good fate." The word is also used as a verb to express praise. The word "guest" is often used in bronze inscriptions to indicate a distinguished guest. The guest bell: "Guest with music."

The bamboo slips of the Warring States period express goodness. "Qi Ye" Jane 6: "Jiajue is quick to drink, and later jue is to follow." This sentence is a word of persuasion, which means to drink this glass of wine quickly, and then take it again. "Jia Jue" see "Book of Rites. "Shi Guan Li": "Memorial to this prince, to inherit the heaven." Or used as a verb to express praise, "Tsinghua Jane One. "Bao Xun" Jian 7: "Emperor Yao Jiazhi."
humanum_short_description_en: Synopsis: The " Jia " in the Jia Jin inscription means that the food container contains food such as wheat and gras. The original meaning is the deliciousness of the food, and the extension is good.
humanum_full_description:
甲骨文從「力」從「豆」從「來」，金文加從「爪」從「口」，以「加」為聲符，陳漢平以為字象「來」(麥子)在「豆」中，表示食器中盛有麥、禾之類食物，本義是食物之美味。甲金文「來」或作「木」。侯馬盟書構形多變，或省去「爪」形，或省去「豆」形。戰國文字「嘉」或省「豆」，參《清華簡一．皇門》簡2。《說文》：「嘉，美也。从壴，加聲。」

　　甲骨文「嘉」用作地名，《合集》36838：「才(在)嘉。」《合集》37434：「今日步于嘉，亡(無)災。」

　　另甲骨文有從「女」從「力」之字，為「妿」之初文。甲骨文「妿」之初文多讀為「嘉」，或與「娩」連用，借以卜問分娩是否順利。《合集》6948：「婦好娩[女力](嘉)。」婦好是商王武丁的妻子，「娩嘉」指分娩順利。一說「嘉」指生男，「不嘉」即生女。《合集》14002正：「帚(婦)好娩，不其[女力](嘉)。」

　　金文「嘉」表示美好，洹子孟姜壺：「齊侯拜嘉命」，「嘉命」即美好的生命。楊樹達：「齊侯有所請而天子許之，且有所授，故謂之嘉命。」字又用作動詞，表示贊美，中山王鼎：「寡人庸其德嘉其力。」另，金文常見「嘉賓」一詞，表示貴客，嘉賓鐘：「用樂嘉賓。」

　　戰國竹簡表示美好，《清華簡一．耆夜》簡6：「嘉爵速飲，後爵乃從。」此句為勸酒之辭，意謂快快飲下這杯美酒，後來再一杯杯接下去。「嘉爵」見《禮記．士冠禮》：「祭此嘉爵，承天之祜。」或用作動詞，表示嘉許，《清華簡一．保訓》簡7：「帝堯嘉之。」
humanum_short_description: 甲金文「嘉」字表示食器中盛有麥、禾之類食物，本義是食物之美味，引申為美好。

甲骨文從「 力 」從「 豆 」從「 來 」，金文加從「 爪 」從「 口 」，以「 加 」為聲符，陳漢平以為字象「 來 」(麥子)在「 豆 」中，表示食器中盛有麥、禾之類食物，本義是食物之美味。甲金文「 來 」或作「 木 」。侯馬盟書構形多變，或省去「 爪 」形，或省去「 豆 」形。戰國文字「 嘉 」或省「 豆 」，參《清華簡一．皇門》簡2。《說文》：「嘉，美也。从壴，加聲。」 甲骨文「 嘉 」用作地名，《合集》36838：「才(在)嘉。」《合集》37434：「今日步于嘉，亡(無)災。」 另甲骨文有從「 女 」從「 力 」之字，為「 妿 」之初文。甲骨文「 妿 」之初文多讀為「 嘉 」，或與「 娩 」連用，借以卜問分娩是否順利。《合集》6948：「婦好娩[女力](嘉)。」婦好是商王武丁的妻子，「娩嘉」指分娩順利。一說「 嘉 」指生男，「不嘉」即生女。《合集》14002正：「帚(婦)好娩，不其[女力](嘉)。」 金文「 嘉 」表示美好，洹子孟姜壺：「齊侯拜嘉命」，「嘉命」即美好的生命。楊樹達：「齊侯有所請而天子許之，且有所授，故謂之嘉命。」字又用作動詞，表示贊美，中山王鼎：「寡人庸其德嘉其力。」另，金文常見「嘉賓」一詞，表示貴客，嘉賓鐘：「用樂嘉賓。」 戰國竹簡表示美好，《清華簡一．耆夜》簡6：「嘉爵速飲，後爵乃從。」此句為勸酒之辭，意謂快快飲下這杯美酒，後來再一杯杯接下去。「嘉爵」見《禮記．士冠禮》：「祭此嘉爵，承天之祜。」或用作動詞，表示嘉許，《清華簡一．保訓》簡7：「帝堯嘉之。」

Jia Jin inscription " come" or " wood". The structure of Houma League books is varied, either the " claw" shape or the " bean" shape is omitted. 嘉字的基本解释

嘉
jiā
善，美：嘉言。嘉宾。嘉言懿行。
夸奖，赞许：嘉奖。嘉许。嘉勉。
吉庆，幸福：嘉祥。嘉偶。
欢乐：嘉会。
姓。

：一般指善、美、赞许、表扬、吉庆、幸福、欢乐等。

Jia
Basic explanation of words
Jia
jiā
Goodness and beauty: good words. Guests. Jia Yan Yixing.
Praise, praise: praise. Recognition. Exhortation.
Good luck, happiness: Jiaxiang. Jia Ou.
Joy: Jiahui.
name.
Jia
Chinese dictionary definition of words
Jia
Kangxi dictionary interpretation of words
Jia
Source glyph
Jia
Name meaning
: Generally refers to kindness, beauty, praise, praise, auspiciousness, happiness, joy, etc.
jiā
I прил.
1) прекрасный, чудесный; превосходный, отличный
嘉禽 чудесная (прекрасная) птица
2) счастливый, радостный
嘉姻 счастливый брак
嘉祥 доброе предвестие (предзнаменование, знамение)
II гл.
1) хвалить, одобрять; радоваться (чему-л.)
其志可嘉 его стремления достойны похвалы
2) радовать
以嘉魂魄 чем и обрадовать души умерших
III собств.
Цзя (фамилия)
Radicals: 壴, 力, 口  (drum, power, mouth)
Meaning Mnemonic
If when you speak it sounds like the power of a drum is coming out of your mouth, then people will hold you in high esteem. Anyone who has a loud, booming, powerful voice will be held in high esteem in this day and age. Look at all those awesome musicians who have booming voices!
Imagine hearing someone speak and it's so powerful and loud that it sounds like they have a drum booming out of their mouth. You'll love them! You'll hold them in the highest esteem!
Reading Mnemonic
You hold them in such high esteem that you give them your car (か). I ... I said you give them your car! Give them your car. Hey, hey!
If you hold someone in high esteem you give me your- give them your car. Gimme!
